title: ACiD Header NFO
description: The iconic NFO header used in ACiD's January 1993 release pack.

title: Dragon's Lair
description: A collaboration between SoMMSS and Eerie depicting a fearsome dragon in vivid ANSI color.

title: Midnight City
description: A monochrome ASCII cityscape rendered entirely in standard characters, predating the color ANSI era.

title: Wizard of the Keep
description: Degauss's iconic wizard portrait, widely considered one of the finest character studies in ANSI history.

title: FireStorm Logo
description: A showcase of iCE color's 16-background-color capability, used as a pack header.

title: Neon Portrait
description: Eerie's celebrated portrait piece, notable for its subtle color blending technique.

title: Deep Space Nine
description: A rare 132-column wide format ANSI depicting a dramatic sci-fi space battle scene.

title: Skull & Crossbones
description: Style's bold skull emblem, often used as a BBS door intro screen.

title: Castle on the Hill
description: An early Cthulu ASCII landscape, showing technical mastery of monochrome shading with standard ASCII.

title: Rose Garden
description: A collaboration piece showcasing organic forms rendered in ANSI — technically challenging and visually stunning.

title: Neon Warrior
description: Lord Jazz's signature character piece — a barbarian warrior in dramatic neon ANSI coloring.

title: Electric Sign
description: Style's tribute to the electric neon sign aesthetic, rendered in warm ANSI yellows and oranges.

title: March Member / Board Listing
description: The official ACiD member and BBS listing for March 1994, one of the marquee pieces of every Acquisition.

title: The Humdinger
description: Arcane Entropy's April Fools entry for the April 1994 Acquisition.

title: Channel Zer0 (2)
description: The second ANSI screen for the Channel Zer0 BBS by Arcane Entropy.

title: Whammy Bar
description: One of the largest scrolling ANSI pieces in the April 1994 Acquisition at 35KB, depicting a rock guitar scene.

title: Programmed Illusion
description: Beige's scrolling ANSI piece for the April 1994 Acquisition, featuring a surreal, abstract composition.

title: End of Time
description: Dark Ray's dramatic End of Time piece, a sweeping apocalyptic landscape in 16-color ANSI.

title: The Icy Connection
description: Dark Ray's BBS screen for The Icy Connection, one of two large pieces contributed to the April 1994 pack.

title: Power Grid
description: The largest scrolling ANSI in the April 1994 Acquisition at 44KB — Imag's Power Grid is a monumental sci-fi composition.

title: Channel Zer0
description: KPad's ANSI screen for Channel Zer0 BBS, the first of two contributions to the April 1994 pack.

title: Electric Acid
description: KPad's Electric Acid — an intense neon-styled ANSI that became one of the most celebrated pieces of the era.

title: Channel Zer0
description: Lord Dregg's Channel Zer0 BBS screen, one of three Zer0 entries across different artists in this pack.

title: Castle of Darkness
description: The crown jewel of the April 1994 Acquisition: Castle of Darkness by Lord Dregg. At 154KB and nearly 2000 lines, it is one of the largest single ANSI pieces ever created.

title: Future Realm II
description: Lord Dregg's Future Realm sequel BBS screen, one of three large pieces from this prolific artist in the April 1994 pack.

title: ACiD Newsletter Issue #3
description: The third issue of the ACiD internal newsletter, documenting group news and upcoming releases.

title: The Thieves' Guild
description: RaD Man's Thieves' Guild BBS screen — a masterclass in fantasy-themed ANSI typography and design.

title: Channel Zer0
description: SiN's massive Channel Zer0 BBS screen — the largest of the four Zer0 screens across this pack at 46KB.

title: Soul Asylum
description: Solo's moodily lit BBS screen for Soul Asylum, demonstrating ACiD's range beyond purely fantasy themes.

title: Digital Illusions
description: T-2000's compact but striking logo piece for the Digital Illusions BBS.

title: Death Row
description: T-2000's Death Row BBS screen became one of the most widely distributed ANSI pieces of 1994.

title: Evil Intention
description: T-2000's Evil Intention BBS screen, complementing the dark themes of the Death Row piece.

title: The Eleventh Hour (2)
description: Second ANSI screen for The Eleventh Hour BBS, one of three TEH screens in this pack across different artists.

title: The Eleventh Hour
description: Tasmaniac's version of The Eleventh Hour BBS screen — by the same coder who built the modem simulation in ACiD View.

title: Dark Sun World
description: Unseen's ANSI companion to the Dark Sun World RIP screens in the same pack, depicting the same BBS across two formats.

title: Federation Network
description: Vertigo Son's sci-fi themed ANSI for the Federation Network BBS.

title: Awakened Earth
description: RaD Man's RIPscrip vector graphic for Awakened Earth BBS — one of six RIP files in the April 1994 Acquisition.

title: Dark Sun World
description: RaD Man's RIP companion to Unseen's ANSI Dark Sun World — same BBS, different format for different terminal software.

title: Danger Unlimited
description: RaD Man's RIPscrip screen for Danger Unlimited BBS.

title: Epic
description: RaD Man's Epic BBS screen in RIPscrip format.

title: Iridium
description: RaD Man's Iridium BBS screen in RIPscrip vector format.

title: SkyNet (2)
description: Second RIP screen for SkyNet BBS by RaD Man; the EXE version was included separately.

title: The Web
description: RaD Man's RIP screen for The Web BBS.

title: End of Time
description: SoMMSS's End of Time RIP screen — the largest RIP file in the pack at 49KB, paired with Dark Ray's ANSI of the same name.

title: Godhead Silo
description: SoMMSS's Godhead Silo RIP screen for an industrial-themed BBS.

title: The Eleventh Hour
description: Spoon's RIP screen for The Eleventh Hour BBS, the third in the pack's collection of Eleventh Hour screens.

title: Beyond Vision
description: Unseen's Beyond Vision RIP screen, paired with their Dark Sun World ANSI in this pack.

title: ACiD Header NFO
description: The iconic NFO header used in ACiD's January 1993 release pack.
